intro: Coccocypselum krauseanum, commonly known as the Krause's coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and palmate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
